definition: mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
the military revolt of 960 that led Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 to found the Song dynasty

sentences.english: China and Africa have long-lasting political instability, several mutinies and coups.
sentences.chinese: 中非政局曾長期持續動盪，多次發生兵變和政變。

sentences.english: In January it broke out into muting.
sentences.chinese: 到了一月份，就爆發成爲兵變。

sentences.english: The immediate cause of the mutiny was the new Enfield rifle.
sentences.chinese: 兵變的直接原因，是新的埃菲爾德步槍。

sentences.english: Several minor mutinies against the British by native soldiers were quickly put down.
sentences.chinese: 幾次本地士兵針對英國的兵變很快被平息。

sentences.english: The result was a court that is overstretched to the point of mutiny.
sentences.chinese: 結果導致法庭過度延展以致兵變。

definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
